content.description: It's a warm up. Unnamed route #5 in Sven's guidebook.
content.location: South side of buttress, pass the overhang on the left.

content.description: Whoa, total sandbag as 5.7 as listed in Sven's guidebook. Sven says to start the route right of the corner. Total crap idea. Start up Pearly Gate and traverse right to the corner and straight up. You can also bypass the crux of Pearly Gate by stepping back left onto the sloping ledge.
content.protection: TR or Trad. Only a brown tri-cam even remotely fit in the very flaring flake halfway up. Not sure if it would have taken a fall. All the gear in the upper half was iffy and the run out to the top was potentially deadly.

content.description: Start a few feet right of the small dihedral capped by a small roof at about 10'.  Climb more or less straight up the slab to a stance below the obvious roof and hanging arete.  Continue straight up the arete to a mantle onto the ledge.
content.protection: Small cams around 20', then some finger to hand sized pieces in the horizontal below the roof. The gear is spaced out, but it is good and in the right spot to keep you off the deck.
content.location: Slab to hanging arete between Pearly Gate and Arm Power.

content.description: O-Gawd! Looks straight forward, ends up tricky as hell. Mantles and stems, not to mention a half pad mono!
content.protection: TR. Zero pro in the upper half.

content.description: Starts off fun but casual. After the horizontal crack small crimps and hard lock offs lead to a mantle onto a ledge. I see the moves but couldn't pull them. A trophy to be won in a place with few trophys left.
content.protection: TR or one solid piece in the horizontal.
content.location: Face right of Arm Power, start in a short corner.

content.description: Start behind big block. Climb to right of the corner using small jugs and small ledges. Continue to top. Variation: Traverse left 2/3's of the way up to cramped ledge. Hand jam crack to the top.
content.protection: Sparse pro, could be lead. Most likely medium nuts and cams. Tree at top for anchors.
content.location: On the small buttress directly to the left of "	St. Peter Says "YES!"".

content.description: Start in a nice left-slanting crack, then up a blunt corner to the overhang. Pass the overhang directly.   This is listed as 11d in Sven's book but to get that you would have to dutifully ignore some pretty good holds.   Short crux about halfway up with gear at your feet. A short running belay will keep you off the deck.
content.protection: Solid cam in the horizontal and some micro gear up high.
content.location: Southeast corner of the buttress, start in a nice left leaning crack.

content.description: Small crag with some pretty tall lines for this part of the cliff.
